document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R22-001
The Community Health Assessment and Community Health Improvement Plan Authorization Act
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 24th day of March, 2022, the following law was adopted:

recital.text: the Pueblo de San Ildefonso (Pueblo) has received funding from the Albuquerque Area Southwest Tribal Epidemiology Center (AASTEC) to allow the Pueblo’s Tribal Health Council and Department of Health and Human Services to participate in and complete a Tribal Public Health Community Health Assessment (CHA); and,

the Pueblo’s Tribal Health Council and Department of Health and Human Services operates under the authority provided by the Tribal Council and acts on behalf of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso for health matters; and,

improving and maintaining the health and wellness needs of its people are primary goals and objectives of the Pueblo, including activities to address the burden of chronic diseases (i.e., cardiovascular disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes), COVID-19, behavioral health and substance use/misuse, and underlying risk factors (i.e., tobacco use, obesity, physical inactivity, poor nutrition, generational and environmental trauma, and adverse childhood experiences (ACEs); and,
the Pueblo acknowledges the last CHA was completed in 2015 and the needs of the community have changed; and,
the Pueblo acknowledges the benefits that can be achieved from completing a CHA in the area of public health and community healthcare; and,
health status measures are often not available at the community level; and,
the CHA was designed to provide a useful and useable tool for tribes to measure their overall health status; and,
the AASTEC will work closely with the Pueblo to identify appropriate health indicators and to ensure that the project is conducted in a confidential and culturally sensitive manner; and,
the identified health indicators may be measured using community surveys, interviews, existing records, or other sources; and,
it is necessary to approve the indicators required in order to complete the CHA; and,
the Council has reviewed this project and has determined it is in the Pueblo’s best interest to move forward with the CHA in collaboration with the AASTEC.
that the Council hereby enacts the attached law entitled “THE COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN AUTHORIZATION ACT.”

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on March 24, 2022, at a meeting with a vote of 9 in favor, 0 opposed, 0 abstaining and 1 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

procedural-data.text: Resolution No. SI-R22-001 was presented to the Governor of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso on the 24th day of March, 2022, pursuant to the Governing document of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Agreement"), GOVERNOR, Sec. 4(c), and will become effective after signature by the Governor or veto override by the Council.

attachment.heading: THE COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN AUTHORIZATION ACT

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "THE COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN AUTHORIZATION ACT" ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to authorize the Pueblo de San Ildefonso's (Pueblo) request to partner with the Albuquerque Area Southwest Tribal Epidemiology Center (AASTEC) to complete a Community Health Assessment and Community Health Improvement Plan (CHA).

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: The Pueblo has received funding from the AASTEC to allow the Pueblo's Tribal Health Council and Department of Health and Human Services to participate and complete a CHA; and
The Pueblo's Tribal Health Council and Department of Health and Human Services operates under the authority provided by the Council and acts on behalf of the Pueblo for health matters; and

The Pueblo has primary goals and objectives of improving and maintaining the health and wellness needs of its people, including activities to address the burden of chronic diseases (i.e., cardiovascular disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes), COVID-19, behavioral health and substance use/misuse, and underlying risk factors (i.e., tobacco use, obesity, physical inactivity, poor nutrition, generational and environmental trauma, and adverse childhood experiences (ACEs); and
The Pueblo acknowledges the last Community Health Assessment (CHA) was completed in 2015 and the needs of the community have changed; and
The Pueblo de San Ildefonso acknowledges the benefits that can be achieved from completing a CHA, in the area of public health and community healthcare; and
Health status measures are often not available at the community level; and
The CHA was designed to provide a useful and useable tool for tribes to measure their overall health status; and
The AASTEC will work closely with the Pueblo to identify appropriate health indicators and to ensure that the project is conducted in a confidential and culturally sensitive manner; and
The identified health indicators may be measured using community surveys, interviews, existing records, or other sources; and
It is necessary to approve the indicators required in order to complete the CHA; and
The Council has reviewed this project and has determined it is in the Pueblo's best interest to move forward with the CHA in collaboration with the AASTEC.
The Council hereby authorizes the Pueblo's Tribal Health Council and Department of Health and Human Services to participate and complete a CHA, beginning March 14, 2022 and ending September 29, 2022.

The authority granted by the Resolution shall remain in effect until withdrawn by the Council or until the term of the new contract has expired, and the Governor is the authorized agent for the Tribe and shall represent the Council in any negotiations, changes and/or approval of the contract agreement.
